meanings.definition: To force open (something) with a lever
meanings.sent1: He pries open the rusty lock with a crowbar.
meanings.sent2: She pries open the stuck window with a screwdriver.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat pries open the cabinet door to explore.
meanings.sent4: Her determination pries open the door to new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight pries open the darkness of the night sky.

meanings.definition: To extract or obtain with effort or difficulty
meanings.sent1: He pries the information from the reluctant witness.
meanings.sent2: She pries the truth from the deceptive suspect.
meanings.sent3: The detective pries out the hidden clue from the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: Her persistence pries out the solution from the complex problem.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pries out the creativity from her students with inspiring lessons.
